page.title: 05Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Chudleigh Knighton village is situated in South Devon between Bovey Tracey & Chudleigh.The nearest town is Newton Abbot and it is about thirteen miles from the cathedral city of Exeter.The word Knighton comes from land which was given as a reward to the knights. In the village there are two shops _a paper shop and a general stores and a Post Office which is part of a private house. The village school and church of St. Paul's are in the centre of the village close by two pubs,the Clay Cutters Arms and the Anchor Inn,both which date back to the 17th century. There are five housing estates, three private ones and two council ones.Dotted around the village are some very old cottages,one group called Candys'cottages,the name taken from the local Candy tile industry for
